aquametNWCA 2.4.4

    • Calculate Metrics
    • Calculate VMMI

    Calculate vascular plant duration metrics

    calcDuration.Rd

    This function calculates all duration metrics, with additional metrics if NWCA_NATSTAT variable is included in input data frame.

    calcDuration(vascIn, sampID = "UID")

    Arguments

    vascIn

    Data frame containing cover data summarized by sampID variables and TAXON, with the following fields:

    • sampID: Variable(s) in the argument sampID

    • TAXON: Taxon name

    • DURATION: USDA PLANTS DURATION variable, with valid values "ANNUAL", "BIENNIAL", "PERENNIAL", combinations of these values, or blank

    • DUR_ALT (optional): Combinations of DURATION into ANNUAL, PERENNIAL, ANN_BIEN, and ANN_PEREN, as used in NWCA. Created in code if not supplied by user.

    • XABCOV: Mean percent cover of taxon across plots

    • TOTN: Number of taxa in sample

    • sXRCOV: proportion of summed cover across all taxa (XTOTABCOV) represented by taxon in sample

    • NWCA_NATSTAT (Optional): Native status variable with categories of 'NAT', 'ADV', 'CRYP', 'INTR', 'UND'

    sampID

    A character vector containing the name(s) of variable(s) necessary to identify unique samples, 'UID' by default

    Value

    Data frame containing the sampID variables, PARAMETER, RESULT, where values of PARAMETER consist of the metric name concatenated with trait value (represented as TRAITNM below):

    • N_TRAITNM: Number of taxa with trait

    • PCTN_TRAITNM: Number of taxa with trait as percentage of TOTN

    • XABCOV_TRAITNM: Sum of XABCOV values across taxa with trait

    • XRCOV_TRAITNM: Sum of sXRCOV values across taxa with trait

    If NWCA_NATSTAT is in the input data frame, the same set except 'N_' metrics is calculated for native species and alien + cryptogenic species, with metric names suffixes of _NAT and _AC, respectively.

    Details

    Both DURATION and NWCA_NATSTAT variables are recoded to fewer categories. Taxa with 'UND' as native status are excluded.

    References

    US Environmental Protection Agency. 2016. National Wetland Condition Assessment: 2011 Technical Report. EPA-843-R-15-006. US Environmental Protection Agency, Washington, DC.

    Author

    Karen Blocksom Blocksom.karen@epa.gov

    Examples

    head(VascPlantEx)
#>   UID STATE USAC_REGION PLOT             USDA_NAME COVER
#> 1   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    2 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA    28
#> 2   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    3 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA     6
#> 3   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    4 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA     5
#> 4   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    5 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA    20
#> 5   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    5       SPARTINA PATENS     0
#> 6   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    1      PANICUM VIRGATUM     0
exPlant <- prepareData(VascPlantEx,
  taxon_name = "USDA_NAME",
  inTaxa = taxaNWCA, inNat = ccNatNWCA, inCVal = ccNatNWCA,
  inWIS = wisNWCA, cValReg = "STATE"
)
#> [1] "Will not be able to calculate metrics using DUR_ALT,GRH_ALT,HERB,TREE_COMB,SHRUB_COMB,VINE_ALL without these parameters in inTaxa"
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "byUID"  "byPlot"
#>  [1] "TAXON"           "STATE"           "UID"             "USAC_REGION"    
#>  [5] "NUM"             "XABCOV"          "NPLOTS"          "DISTINCT"       
#>  [9] "SPECIES_NAME_ID" "FAMILY"          "GENUS"           "CATEGORY"       
#> [13] "GROWTH_HABIT"    "DURATION"        "NWCA_CC"        
#>  [1] "TAXON"           "USAC_REGION"     "STATE"           "UID"            
#>  [5] "NUM"             "XABCOV"          "NPLOTS"          "DISTINCT"       
#>  [9] "SPECIES_NAME_ID" "FAMILY"          "GENUS"           "CATEGORY"       
#> [13] "GROWTH_HABIT"    "DURATION"        "NWCA_CC"         "NWCA_NATSTAT"   
#> [17] "WIS"            
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "Done preparing datasets"

durEx <- calcDuration(exPlant$byUIDspp)
head(durEx)
#>                UID   PARAMETER RESULT
#> 8.N_PERENNIAL    8 N_PERENNIAL      4
#> 5.N_PERENNIAL    5 N_PERENNIAL      5
#> 9.N_PERENNIAL    9 N_PERENNIAL      7
#> 7.N_PERENNIAL    7 N_PERENNIAL      8
#> 10.N_PERENNIAL  10 N_PERENNIAL      9
#> 1.N_PERENNIAL    1 N_PERENNIAL     18
unique(durEx$PARAMETER)
#>  [1] "N_PERENNIAL"          "N_ANNUAL"             "N_ANN_PEREN"         
#>  [4] "N_ANN_BIEN"           "PCTN_PERENNIAL"       "PCTN_ANNUAL"         
#>  [7] "PCTN_ANN_PEREN"       "PCTN_ANN_BIEN"        "XABCOV_PERENNIAL"    
#> [10] "XABCOV_ANNUAL"        "XABCOV_ANN_PEREN"     "XABCOV_ANN_BIEN"     
#> [13] "XRCOV_PERENNIAL"      "XRCOV_ANNUAL"         "XRCOV_ANN_PEREN"     
#> [16] "XRCOV_ANN_BIEN"       "N_ANNUAL_NAT"         "PCTN_ANNUAL_NAT"     
#> [19] "XABCOV_ANNUAL_NAT"    "XRCOV_ANNUAL_NAT"     "N_ANNUAL_AC"         
#> [22] "PCTN_ANNUAL_AC"       "XABCOV_ANNUAL_AC"     "XRCOV_ANNUAL_AC"     
#> [25] "N_ANN_BIEN_NAT"       "PCTN_ANN_BIEN_NAT"    "XABCOV_ANN_BIEN_NAT" 
#> [28] "XRCOV_ANN_BIEN_NAT"   "N_ANN_BIEN_AC"        "PCTN_ANN_BIEN_AC"    
#> [31] "XABCOV_ANN_BIEN_AC"   "XRCOV_ANN_BIEN_AC"    "N_ANN_PEREN_NAT"     
#> [34] "PCTN_ANN_PEREN_NAT"   "XABCOV_ANN_PEREN_NAT" "XRCOV_ANN_PEREN_NAT" 
#> [37] "N_ANN_PEREN_AC"       "PCTN_ANN_PEREN_AC"    "XABCOV_ANN_PEREN_AC" 
#> [40] "XRCOV_ANN_PEREN_AC"   "N_PERENNIAL_NAT"      "PCTN_PERENNIAL_NAT"  
#> [43] "XABCOV_PERENNIAL_NAT" "XRCOV_PERENNIAL_NAT"  "N_PERENNIAL_AC"      
#> [46] "PCTN_PERENNIAL_AC"    "XABCOV_PERENNIAL_AC"  "XRCOV_PERENNIAL_AC"
